overview_summary: All four profiled neighbors have no documented stance on the proposed development (0 support, 0 oppose, 4 unknown). None hold any known official positions or leadership roles in Lee County, suggesting limited community influence among this group. Each appears to be a private landowner without public advocacy on development or energy issues.

neighbors.name: Alexander A. Petrovets
neighbors.claims: Alexander A. Petrovets is recorded as a landowner in Lee County, but the Petrovets surname is very rare and there is no public profile or community history documented for him ([freepeoplesearch.com](https://freepeoplesearch.com/Petrov/Aleksandr/#:~:text=20%20Free%20People%20Search%20Records,Address%20History%3A%203522%20Crepe%20Myrtle)). No evidence was found of Petrovets holding any local office or voicing opinions on development or energy projects in the area ([freepeoplesearch.com](https://freepeoplesearch.com/Petrov/Aleksandr/#:~:text=20%20Free%20People%20Search%20Records,Address%20History%3A%203522%20Crepe%20Myrtle)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public role or influence seen

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a project representative reach out personally to Petrovets, listening to any land-use or property concerns and highlighting potential benefits for his land.

neighbors.name: John Michael McConnell
neighbors.claims: This name matches that of a former U.S. Director of National Intelligence, but the Lee County landowner is not confirmed to be the same person (the famous Mike McConnell was born in 1943 in Greenville, SC) ([www.encyclopedia.com](https://www.encyclopedia.com/law/legal-and-political-magazines/mcconnell-john-michael#:~:text=McConnell%2C%20John%20Michael%20,He%20earned%20a)). No local news or records indicate any involvement by John M. McConnell in community meetings or any public stance on development issues ([www.encyclopedia.com](https://www.encyclopedia.com/law/legal-and-political-magazines/mcconnell-john-michael#:~:text=McConnell%2C%20John%20Michael%20,He%20earned%20a)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. McConnell in a one-on-one conversation, possibly via a trusted local contact, to understand his viewpoint and emphasize how the project can respect and even support agricultural land use.

neighbors.name: Benjamin J. & Mona S. Chua
neighbors.claims: Benjamin J. Chua and Mona S. Chua jointly own a parcel in Lee County, and they appear to be private individuals with no presence in local media or civic records (online searches for their name mainly turn up unrelated individuals, such as a doctor by the same name in Singapore) ([oncocare.sg](https://oncocare.sg/specialists/dr-benjamin-chuah/#:~:text=Dr%20Benjamin%20Chuah%20,59%20LANGUAGES%20SPOKEN%3A%20English)). There are no public statements or reported activities by the Chuas regarding development or renewable energy in the community ([oncocare.sg](https://oncocare.sg/specialists/dr-benjamin-chuah/#:~:text=Dr%20Benjamin%20Chuah%20,59%20LANGUAGES%20SPOKEN%3A%20English)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Chuas with informative outreach, reassuring them that their rural lifestyle and property values will be respected. Emphasize open communication to address any questions about project impacts.

neighbors.name: Lottie Mae Williams
neighbors.claims: Lottie Mae Williams was an 83-year-old longtime Bishopville resident; she passed away on September 6, 2025 ([www.jpholley.com](https://www.jpholley.com/obituaries/lottie-williams#:~:text=September%2021%2C%201941%20%E2%80%94%20September,6%2C%202025)). Her funeral was held at a local church, and her obituary did not note any public offices or activism, suggesting she was not actively involved in civic debates on development ([www.jpholley.com](https://www.jpholley.com/obituaries/lottie-williams#:~:text=A%20Celebration%20of%20Life%20Service,Tema%20Road%2C%20Hartsville%2C%20South%20Carolina)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Elder resident; not in public office

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Ms. Williams’ family or estate executor. Emphasize respect for the family’s legacy on the land and discuss how the project will honor that heritage while addressing any concerns the family raises.
